intro: Maianthemum racemosum, commonly known as the clustered false lily of the valley, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Melanthiaceae. It is a perennial herb characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and small, white or pale green flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and forest floors. Its rhizomatous growth habit allows it to spread and form dense colonies. It is native to parts of North America and is often found in the eastern United States.
